Title: zsh symlink execute problem
Description:
I found an odd behavior with zsh:

autoload zsh-mime-setup; zsh-mime-setup sets alias -s py=zsh-mime-handler which leads to following problem:

If I try to execute a #!/usr/bin/env python shebang-ed python script, it works well. But as soon as I symlink said script, and execute the symlink, it will try to open the file with less, as seems to be configured zsh-mime-setup -l|grep py.

tl;dr;
zsh-mime-handler does not seem to handle symlinks of executables well.

zsh-Version: 4.3.17

[UPDATE] I found some context: apparently this was adressed in 2006 over at debian after 4.3.2-2: https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=339635 -- however it seems to still persist in 5.0.2 (see https://asciinema.org/a/9533)
